title: Sheriff: Teen's shooting under investigation
content:
Authorities are investigating after a 14-year-old boy was shot in the county Wednesday evening.
Pontotoc County Sheriff John Christian said the boy told his grandparents and authorities he was walking down County Road 1610 west of Ada, near the county line, when he felt a thump on his side, looked down and was bleeding from a hole in his side.
The teen went home and informed his grandparents. The boy’s grandfather immediately drove the teen to Mercy Hospital Ada, where he was airlifted to OU Medical Center in Oklahoma City.
Christian said an investigation by Deputy Todd Young has raised the possibility the boy accidentally shot himself.
“Deputy Young investigated and found evidence at the boy’s home that indicate the boy had probably a .22-caliber rifle in or near the residence, accidentally shooting himself,” the sheriff’s office said.
Christian said the boy’s clothing had evidence which indicated it was a close-range shot.
Christian said the boy is doing well after having surgery to remove the bullet and his spleen. The investigation continues, and deputies will interview the boy after he recovers.
